After joining [[Athletic Bilbao]] in 2010 at the age of 16, he became only the second French player – after [[Bixente Lizarazu]] – to play for them,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/europaleague/story/apoel-kiryat-shmona-0-2-athletic-bilbao-europa-league-match-report-112812h|title=Athletic Bilbao makes easy work of Hapoel IKS|publisher=[[Fox Sports]]|date=29 November 2012|accessdate=8 December 2012}}</ref> going on to make 220 competitive appearances for the club and score ten goals. In January 2018, he signed for Manchester City.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.es/deportes/futbol/abci-laporte-posa-como-jugador-5722453230001-20180130015032_video.html|title=Laporte ya posa como jugador del Manchester City|trans-title=Laporte already posing as a Manchester City player|newspaper=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=30 January 2018|accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref>
Laporte won 51 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for [[France national youth football team|France at youth level]].
==Club career== ===Athletic Bilbao=== Laporte was born in [[Agen]], [[Aquitaine]] and is of [[Basques|Basque]] descent through his great-grandparents.<ref name=Blood>{{cite web|url=http://bizkaia.eldesmarque.com/athletic-club/noticias/36668-laporte-tengo-sangre-vasca-por-parte-de-mis-bisabuelos|title=Laporte: "Tengo sangre vasca por parte de mis bisabuelos"|trans-title=Laporte: "I have Basque blood through my great-grandparents"|publisher=El Desmarque|first=Javi|last=Beltrán|language=Spanish|date=25 July 2013|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref> He started playing football and [[Rugby football|rugby]] at the age of five, and began his development at [[SU Agen Football]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footmercato.net/liga/entretien-avec-aymeric-laporte-s-entrainer-avec-fernando-llorente-ce-n-est-pas-donne-a-tout-le_94518|title=Entretien avec... Aymeric Laporte|trans-title=Interview with... Aymeric Laporte|website=Foot Mercato|first=Khaled|last=Karouri|language=French|date=4 November 2012|accessdate=26 May 2013}}</ref><ref name=Among>{{cite web|url=http://onlyfootball.fr/?p=513|title=Aymeric Laporte, un Basque parmi les Basques|trans-title=Aymeric Laporte, a Basque among the Basques|website=Only Football|language=French|date=14 May 2013|accessdate=12 July 2017}}</ref><ref name=Bio>{{cite web|url=http://www.aymericlaporte.com/en/bio/|title=Biography – Athletic Bilbao signing and beginnings|publisher=Official website|accessdate=22 June 2017}}</ref> In 2009 he was invited to join [[Athletic Bilbao]] after being scouted,<ref name=Among/><ref name=Bio/> prompting debate over whether his signing met the criteria of [[Athletic Bilbao signing policy|their policy]] due to his tenuous links to the [[Basque Country (greater region)|Basque region]];<ref name=Blood/><ref name=Among/><ref name=Butterflies>{{cite web|url=http://www.sofoot.com/aymeric-laporte-a-arrete-de-regarder-les-papillons-173450.html|title=Aymeric Laporte a "arrêté de regarder les papillons"|trans-title=Aymeric Laporte "stopped watching the butterflies"|website=So Foot|language=French|date=26 September 2013|accessdate=12 July 2017}}</ref> by arrangement with the club, he spent a season with [[Aviron Bayonnais FC]]<ref name=Bio/><ref name=Butterflies/> as he was too young to move outside France at the time.
Laporte arrived in [[Bilbao]] formally in 2010, joining Athletic's youth setup at [[Lezama Facilities|Lezama]] and going on to play for its [[CD Basconia|farm]] and [[Bilbao Athletic|reserve teams]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/deportes/20120428/54286365543/aymeric-laporte-cachorro-valioso.html|title=Aymeric Laporte, el cachorro más valioso|trans-title=Aymeric Laporte, most valuable pup|newspaper=[[La Vanguardia]]|first=Roberto|last=Rodríguez|location=Barcelona|language=Spanish|date=28 April 2012|accessdate=15 May 2013}}</ref> On 28 November 2012 he was given his debut with the main squad by manager [[Marcelo Bielsa]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sport.sfr.fr/football/premier-league/de-bielsa-a-guardiola-laporte-raconte-ses-mentors.html|title=De Bielsa à Guardiola: Laporte raconte ses mentors|trans-title=From Bielsa to Guardiola: Laporte tells his mentors|publisher=[[SFR]]|language=French|date=25 February 2018|accessdate=5 June 2018}}</ref> playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–0 away win against [[Hapoel Ironi Kiryat Shmona F.C.]] for [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|the season]]'s [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000356/match=2010004/index.html|title=Athletic post comfortable Kiryat Shmona win|publisher=UEFA|date=28 November 2012|accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref>
Laporte made his first [[La Liga]] appearance on 9 December 2012, appearing one minute in a 1–0 home win over [[Celta de Vigo]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2012_13/primera/jornada_15/ath_cel/|title=El Athletic tiene suficiente con Aduriz|trans-title=Athletic have enough with Aduriz|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=Delfín|last=Melero|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=9 December 2012|accessdate=10 December 2012}}</ref> He was inserted in the starting XI the following week, helping the ''Lions'' to the same result at [[RCD Mallorca]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348361/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Aduriz wins it for Bilbao|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=15 December 2012|accessdate=16 December 2012}}</ref> and was definitely promoted to the first team shortly after, signing a new contract until 2015;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.athletic-club.eus/cas/noticias/12731/laporte-jugador-de-la-primera-plantilla.html|title=Laporte, jugador de la primera plantilla|trans-title=Laporte, first-team player|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|language=Spanish|date=17 December 2012|accessdate=21 January 2015}}</ref> on 14 January 2013, he was given the number 4 jersey previously worn by [[Ustaritz Aldekoaotalora|Ustaritz]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.athletic-club.eus/cas/noticias/12779/dorsal-de-aymeric-laporte.html|title=Dorsal de Aymeric Laporte|trans-title=Aymeric Laporte's number|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|language=Spanish|date=14 January 2013|accessdate=21 January 2015}}</ref> and late in the month he renewed his contract, running until 2016 and with a €27.5 million release clause.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2013/01/28/futbol/equipos/athletic/1359380216.html|title=Laporte renueva hasta 2016|trans-title=Laporte renews until 2016|newspaper=Marca|first=Rafa|last=Beato|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=28 January 2013|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref>
Laporte became an undisputed starter under new coach [[Ernesto Valverde]], also being deployed as [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]] on occasion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ligabbva.es/3228_athletic-de-bilbao/2160744_valverde-prueba-a-laporte-de-lateral-y-saborit-de-interior.html|title=Valverde prueba a Laporte de lateral y Saborit de of [[2013–14 La Liga|the campaign]], he was voted into the [[LFP Awards#Team of the Year|La Liga Team of the Year]] by the reporters of the [[Liga de Fútbol Profesional]].<ref name=2014a>{{cite 2016}}</ref>
In June 2015, Laporte extended his link until 2019 with a release clause of €50 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/athletic-bilbao/story/2480397/aymeric-laporte-signs-four-year-athletic-bilbao-deal|title=Aymeric Laporte signs four-year deal to remain at Athletic Bilbao|publisher=ESPN FC|date=5 June 2015|accessdate=28 August 2015}}</ref> After [[2015 Copa del Rey Final|losing the final]] of the [[Copa del Rey]] to [[FC Barcelona]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/may/30/athletic-bilbao-barcelona-copa-del-rey-final-match-report|title=Lionel Messi double gives Barcelona Cup final win over Athletic Bilbao|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Sid|last=Lowe|date=30 May 2015|accessdate=31 January 2018}}</ref> he played both legs of [[2015 Supercopa de España|the year]]'s [[Supercopa de España]] triumph against the same opposition, Athletic's first silverware for 31 years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/spanish-super-cup/match/427686/athletic-bilbao-barcelona/report|title=Barcelona stunned 4–0 by Athletic Bilbao in first leg of Super Cup|publisher=ESPN FC|date=14 August 2015|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref><ref name=SUPERCUP>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/spanish-super-cup/match/427685/barcelona-athletic-bilbao/report|title=Athletic Bilbao manage draw at Barcelona to win Spanish Super Cup|publisher=ESPN FC|date=17 August 2015|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref>
On 13 June 2016, Laporte renewed his contract until 2020, with his buyout clause rising to an initial €65 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/story/2892534/aymeric-laporte-signs-new-athletic-bilbao-contract|title=Aymeric Laporte signs new Athletic Bilbao contract until 2020|publisher=ESPN FC|date=13 June 2016|access-date=14 June 2016}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== Near the end of the winter transfer window of January 2018, Laporte signed for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for a reported fee of £57 million (his contractual [[release clause]] amount and a record-breaking figure for both clubs). He was given the number 14 jersey,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42873612|title=Aymeric Laporte: Manchester City sign French defender for club-record £57m|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=30 January 2018|accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> while Athletic immediately spent around half of the fee on [[Iñigo Martínez]] as a replacement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/athletic-bilbao-sign-martinez-from-real-sociedad/g2qcqw6nfa8t1fj74qrh862fb|title=Athletic Bilbao sign Inigo Martinez to replace Aymeric Laporte|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|date=30 January 2018|accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut the following day, playing the entire 3–0 home win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42799045|title=Manchester City 3–0 West Bromwich Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mike|last=Henson|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018}}</ref>
Laporte scored his first goal for City on 25 August 2018, equalising against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in a 1–1 away draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45230636|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Phil|last=McNulty|date=25 August 2018|accessdate=25 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Laporte represented [[France national football team|France]] at [[France national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[France national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[France national under-21 football team|under-21 levels]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20140227/futbol/laporte-convocado-para-la-sub-21-por-francia_54402647025.html|title=Laporte, convocado para la sub 21 por Francia|trans-title=Laporte, called up to France under-21|newspaper=Mundo Deportivo|location=Barcelona|language=Spanish|date=27 February 2014|accessdate=22 April 2014}}</ref> [[Captain (association football)|captaining]] each side.<ref name=Spain>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/european-championship-qualifying/story/2652467/athletic-bilbao-aymeric-laporte-would-consider-spain-call|title=Athletic Bilbao's Aymeric Laporte would consider Spain call|publisher=ESPN FC|date=7 October 2015|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref> He was part of the under-19 team that came runners-up to [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia]] in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]] in Lithuania, and was selected in the Team of the Tournament.<ref name=UEFA>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/technical-report/tr-under19-2013.pdf|title=Technical report|publisher=UEFA|pages=18–19|format=PDF|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref>
On 24 March 2016, in a [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|2017 European Under-21 Championship qualifier]] against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]] in [[Angers]], Laporte was stretchered off with a fracture and dislocation to his right [[fibula]] and ankle, concluding his season prematurely.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/aymeric-laporte-injury-manchester-city-transfer-plans-dealt-a-blow-as-top-target-suffers-serious-a6951786.html|title=Aymeric Laporte injury: Manchester City transfer plans dealt a blow as top target suffers fractured ankle|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|location=London|last=De Menezes|first=Jack|date=25 March 2016|accessdate=11 April 2016}}</ref> Previously, in October 2015, he stated that he would consider representing [[Spain national football team|Spain]] if rejected by France for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref name=Spain/>
In August 2016, at the behest of new national manager [[Julen Lopetegui]], Laporte began the process of making himself eligible for Spain.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/seleccion/2016/08/30/57c489e146163f72308b4591.html|title=Lopetegui 'ficha' a Laporte|trans-title=Lopetegui 'signs' Laporte|newspaper=Marca|first=Enrique|last=Ortego|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=30 August 2016|accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref> A month later, he was called up to the senior France squad for [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualifiers]] against [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] in October,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/euro-2012/equipe-de-france/actualites/deschamps-appelle-laporte-et-laisse-giroud-a-la-maison-826710|title=Équipe de France: Laporte arrive, Fekir revient|trans-title=France team: Laporte arrives, Fekir returns|newspaper=[[Le Figaro]]|location=Paris|language=French|date=29 September 2016|accessdate=30 September 2016}}</ref> and stated he had decided not to apply for Spanish nationality with the continued aim of playing for France.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://rmcsport.bfmtv.com/football/aymeric-laporte-je-pouvais-prendre-la-nationalite-espagnole-je-ne-l-ai-pas-fait-1043930.html |title=Aymeric Laporte: "Je pouvais prendre la nationalité espagnole, je ne l’ai pas fait"|trans-title=Aymeric Laporte: "I could take Spanish nationality, I did not do so"|publisher=[[BFM TV]]|language=French|date=3 October 2016|accessdate=16 June 2017}}</ref> He did not take part in either match.
==Style of play== Spanish football journalist [[Guillem Balagué]] described Laporte as a "centre-back who can play from the back and is strong", adding that "he is certainly a powerful defender".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12037/11220803/man-city-likely-to-sign-aymeric-laporte-for-60m-says-guillem-balague|title=Man City likely to sign Aymeric Laporte for £60m, says Guillem Balagué|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|first=Guillem|last=Balagué|date=24 January 2018|accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref>
